title: Hyundai Ioniq 5
content:
{{Short description|2021 battery electric car}} {{Distinguish|Hyundai Ioniq}} {{Use dmy dates|date=September 2022}} {{Infobox automobile | name = Hyundai Ioniq 5 (NE) | image = Hyundai Ioniq 5 Uniq-Paket – f 27062021.jpg | manufacturer = [[Hyundai Motor Company|Hyundai]] | production = March 2021 – present | model_years = 2022–present (North America) | assembly = {{Unbulleted list | South Korea: [[Ulsan]] ([[Hyundai Ulsan Plant|Ulsan Plant 1]]){{Cite web|last=서울경제|date=30 March 2021|title='아이오닉5·코나' 현대차 울산1공장 4월 7~14일부터 생산 중단|url=https://www.sedaily.com/NewsView/22K0D55DBR/GD0101|access-date=15 August 2021|website=서울경제|language=ko|archive-date=15 August 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210815041316/https://www.sedaily.com/NewsView/22K0D55DBR/GD0101|url-status=live}} | Indonesia: [[Cikarang|Cikarang, West Java]] ([[Hyundai Motor Manufacturing Indonesia|HMMI]]){{Cite web |title=Hyundai Perkuat Inovasinya di Indonesia Melalui Peresmian Pabrik Pertama di Asia Tenggara |url=https://www.hyundai.com/id/id/hyundai-story/news.1150.L |access-date=18 March 2022 |website=Hyundai Motors |language=id}} | India: [[Chennai]] ([[Hyundai Motor India|HMIL]]) }} | designer = Lee Ji Hyeon{{Cite web|title=DM/213 429|url=https://www3.wipo.int/designdb/hague/en/showData.jsp?SOURCE=HAGUE&KEY=D213429|publisher=[[WIPO]]}} | class = [[Compact crossover SUV]] {{cite web|url=https://www.caranddriver.com/hyundai/ioniq-5|title=2023 Hyundai Ioniq 5|publisher=Car and Driver|access-date=2022-12-21}} | body_style = 5-door [[SUV]] | layout = {{Unbulleted list | [[Rear-motor, rear-wheel-drive]] | [[Dual-motor, all-wheel-drive]] }} | platform = [[Hyundai E-GMP]] | related = {{Unbulleted list | [[Hyundai Ioniq 6]] | [[Kia EV6]] | [[Genesis GV60]] }} | motor = EM07/EM17 [[permanent magnet synchronous motor]] | battery = 58–77.4{{nbsp}}kWh [[Lithium nickel manganese cobalt oxides|nickel-cobalt-manganese lithium]]{{Cite web|title=I Drove The 800-Volt Hyundai Ioniq 5, The First Car On The 'Revolutionary' E-GMP Platform. It's Fantastic|url=https://jalopnik.com/i-drove-the-800-volt-hyundai-ioniq-5-the-first-car-on-1848191542|language=en}} | electric_range = Up to {{cvt|481|km|mi|0}} | charging = {{ubl | '''[[Alternating current|AC]]:'''
11 kW | '''[[Direct current|DC]]:'''
220 kW at 800 V charging stations | '''[[Reverse charging]] ({{abbr|V2L|Vehicle-To-Load}}):'''
Up to 3.6kW {{cite web |url=https://www.hyundaiusa.com/us/en/vehicles/ioniq-5 |title=Hyundai IONIQ 5 Features |work=Charging |publisher=[[Hyundai Motor Group|Hyundai]] |url-status=live |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20221017012637/https://www.hyundai.com/eu/models/ioniq5/features.html |archivedate=2022-10-16 |accessdate=2022-10-17 }} }} | wheelbase = {{cvt|3000|mm|in|1}} | length = {{cvt|4635|mm|in|1}} | width = {{cvt|1890|mm|in|1}} | height = {{cvt|1605|mm|in|1}} | weight = {{Unbulleted list | {{cvt|1830|-|1950|kg|0}} (58{{nbsp}}kWh) | {{cvt|1910|-|2100|kg|0}} (72.6{{nbsp}}kWh) | {{cvt|4200|-|4662|lb|kg|order=flip|0}} (77.4{{nbsp}}kWh) }} }} The '''Hyundai Ioniq 5''' ({{lang-ko|현대 아이오닉 5}}) is a [[Battery electric vehicle|battery electric]] [[compact crossover SUV]] produced by [[Hyundai Motor Company|Hyundai]]. It is the first product to be marketed under the electric cars-focused [[Ioniq]] sub-brand, and the first model developed on the [[Hyundai Electric Global Modular Platform|Hyundai Electric Global Modular Platform (E-GMP)]].{{cite news |author1=Joey Capparella |title=2022 Hyundai Ioniq 5 Production EV Previewed before February Reveal |url=https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a35196654/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-preview/ |access-date=15 January 2021 |date=13 January 2021 |archive-date=29 March 2021 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210329110807/https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a35196654/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-preview/ |url-status=live }} It was revealed globally on 23 February 2021.{{Cite web|title=2022 Hyundai Ioniq 5 Revealed With Concept Look, Ultra-Fast Charging|url=https://www.motor1.com/news/489888/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-reveal/|access-date=23 February 2021|website=Motor1.com|language=en|archive-date=23 February 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210223070351/https://www.motor1.com/news/489888/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-reveal/|url-status=live}} == Overview == The design was previewed by the Hyundai 45 EV Concept which was presented at the [[International Motor Show Germany#2019|Frankfurt Motor Show]] in September 2019. Both the concept car and the production version are inspired by the original [[Hyundai Pony]],{{Cite web|last=Meiners|first=Jens|date=12 April 2021|title=1970s Hyundai Pony Restored with EV Powertrain, Ultra-Cool Interior|url=https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a36087857/hyundai-pony-ev-revealed/|access-date=2 July 2021|website=Car and Driver|language=en-US|archive-date=17 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210417052442/https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a36087857/hyundai-pony-ev-revealed/|url-status=live}} and features the Parametric Pixel design that is applied to the headlights, tail lights, and wheels. The vehicle's clamshell hood spans the entire width to make a sleek look with the 20-inch aerodynamic wheels.{{Cite news|title=미래형 전기차 '아이오닉 5' 이미지 첫 공개… "살짝 설렜어 난"|work=서울신문|url=https://www.seoul.co.kr/news/newsView.php?id=20210113500147&wlog_tag3=naver|url-status=live|access-date=13 January 2021|archive-date=28 January 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210128004911/https://www.seoul.co.kr/news/newsView.php?id=20210113500147&wlog_tag3=naver}} The "45" describes both the 45th anniversary of the Pony coupe and the 45-degree angles prominent on the sides of the concept.{{cite news |author=Priddle, Alisa |date=10 September 2019 |title=Remember the Hyundai Pony? EV Concept Honors Brand's First Car in Frankfurt |work=Motor Trend |url=https://www.motortrend.com/news/hyundai-pony-45-ev-concept-electric-compact-frankfurt-first-look/ |access-date=22 December 2021}} At the time, Hyundai called the design language "sensuous sportiness" and described the front and rear lights as carrying a "kinetic cube" theme.{{cite news |author=Halvorson, Bengt |date=11 September 2019 |title=Hyundai hatches an electric future with retro 45 EV concept |work=Green Car Reports |url=https://www.greencarreports.com/news/1124993_hyundai-hatches-an-electric-future-with-retro-45-ev-concept |access-date=22 December 2021}} Developed under the project code ''NE'', it is the first vehicle to be based on the E-GMP platform.{{cite web|author=Florent Ferrière|date=10 August 2020|title=Hyundai : Ioniq devient une marque, premier modèle en 2021|url=https://www.caradisiac.com/hyundai-ioniq-devient-une-marque-premier-modele-en-2021-184843.htm|publication-date=|access-date=15 September 2020|archive-date=24 September 2020|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20200924210726/https://www.caradisiac.com/hyundai-ioniq-devient-une-marque-premier-modele-en-2021-184843.htm|url-status=live}}{{cite web|last1=Evans|first1=Brett T.|title=Hyundai Teases Upcoming 2022 Ioniq 5 EV With Three Images|url=https://www.motor1.com/news/465808/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-teaser/d|access-date=15 January 2021|website=motor1.com|archive-date=9 October 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211009144028/https://www.motor1.com/news/465808/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-teaser/|url-status=live}} The dedicated electric vehicle platform enables the vehicle to adopt a fully flat interior floor with a 3-meter long wheelbase. The flat floor allows Hyundai engineers to develop a sliding front central console, which is able to slide backwards by {{cvt|140|mm|in|1}}. It has a cargo capacity of {{cvt|531|L|cuft|sigfig=3}} behind the rear seats that can be increased to nearly {{cvt|1600|L|cuft|sigfig=3}} with the second row seats folded.{{Cite web|title=Hyundai IONIQ 5 Revealed As Sleek, Stylish CUV: It's Not A Hatchback|url=https://insideevs.com/news/489883/hyundai-ioniq-5-cuv-debut-not-hatchback/|access-date=23 February 2021|website=InsideEVs|language=en|archive-date=23 February 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210223074826/https://insideevs.com/news/489883/hyundai-ioniq-5-cuv-debut-not-hatchback/|url-status=live}} The dashboard is dominated by two {{cvt|12|in|mm|disp=flip}} screens, one for the instrument cluster display and the other for the infotainment system under one piece of glass. It is equipped with an optional [[head-up display]] with [[augmented reality]] support. Many of the interior parts are made from recycled materials, including [[PET bottles]]. The roof consists of a single large glass panel without any support beams.{{Cite web|last=Beresford|first=Colin|date=23 February 2021|title=2022 Hyundai Ioniq 5 Kicks Off EV Lineup in Eye-Catching Style|url=https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a35590236/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-revealed/|access-date=23 February 2021|website=Car and Driver|language=en-US|archive-date=23 February 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210223070421/https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a35590236/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-revealed/|url-status=live}} The Ioniq 5 also features a front trunk, which has a {{cvt|57|L|cuft|sigfig=3}} capacity for the RWD version (except North America), while the AWD model and all North American versions have a {{cvt|24|L|cuft|sigfig=3}} capacity, due to the extra mechanical components underneath to support the front electric motor.{{Cite web|title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 revealed with impressive numbers, concept car looks|url=https://www.autoblog.com/2021/02/23/hyundai-ioniq-5-reveal/|access-date=23 February 2021|website=Autoblog|language=en|archive-date=23 February 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210223070611/https://www.autoblog.com/2021/02/23/hyundai-ioniq-5-reveal/|url-status=live}} It has the ability to charge electrical equipment through the built-in [[Vehicle-to-grid|V2L (Vehicle to Load)]] function. It can supply up to 3.6{{nbsp}}kW of power from the port mounted under the rear seats (except Australia) and from another port installed outside. The exterior port is able to supply power even if the vehicle is turned off. In some markets, the Ioniq 5 is offered with an optional Digital Side Mirror (DSM) which replaces the conventional side mirrors with cameras and [[OLED]] screens.{{Cite web |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 Digital Side Mirror Works Just Fine: Test Drive |url=https://insideevs.com/reviews/510105/hyundai-ioniq5-digital-side-mirror/ |access-date=2022-09-19 |website=InsideEVs |language=en}} File:Hyundai Ioniq 5 Uniq-Paket – h 27062021.jpg|Rear view File:Hyundai Ioniq 5 IAA 2021 1X7A0217.jpg|Interior File:Hyundai 45 EV Concept at IAA 2019 IMG 0683.jpg|Hyundai 45 EV Concept (2019) === Robotaxi === The Ioniq 5 [[Robotaxi]] was unveiled on 31 August 2021 and displayed at IAA Mobility 2021 on 6 September 2021.{{Cite news|title=Hyundai's joint venture unveils basic design of robotaxi based on IONIQ 5|work=Aju Business Daily |url=https://www.ajudaily.com/view/20210901090352760|access-date=1 September 2021}}{{Cite news|title=Motional To Launch Driverless Robotaxis in Las Vegas in 2023|work=Forbes|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/samabuelsamid/2021/11/09/motional-to-launch-driverless-robotaxis-in-las-vegas-in-2023/?sh=1b1aa054714e|access-date=9 November 2021}} Lyft began offering transport by driver-less Ioniq 5 Robotaxis on the Las Vegas Strip on 16 August 2022.{{Cite web |date=16 August 2022 |title=Lyft offering driverless robotaxis on the Las Vegas Strip |url=https://www.8newsnow.com/news/local-news/lyft-offering-driverless-robotaxis-on-the-las-vegas-strip/ |access-date=22 August 2022 |publisher=KLAS |language=en-US}} The Ioniq 5 Robotaxi will have a human driver present until the end of 2022, after which the cars will operate on their own. File:Hyundai Ioniq 5 Robotaxi IAA 2021 1X7A0002.jpg|Robotaxi File:Hyundai Ioniq 5 Robotaxi IAA 2021 1X7A0317.jpg|Rear view == Powertrain == The vehicle is available with 58{{nbsp}}kWh or 72.6{{nbsp}}kWh battery capacity options, while the North American version will only be available with the 58{{nbsp}}kWh or 77.4{{nbsp}}kWh batteries. Every Ioniq 5 has a top speed of {{convert|185|km/h|mph|0|abbr=on}}.{{Cite web|title=2022 Ioniq 5 revealed: Retro-styled electric car leads a New Wave of EVs|url=https://www.greencarreports.com/news/1131361_2022-ioniq-5-revealed-retro-styled-electric-car-leads-a-new-wave-of-evs|access-date=23 February 2021|website=Green Car Reports|language=en|archive-date=23 February 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210223094136/https://www.greencarreports.com/news/1131361_2022-ioniq-5-revealed-retro-styled-electric-car-leads-a-new-wave-of-evs|url-status=live}} The battery can recharge {{convert|86|km|mi|abbr=on}} of range in 5 minutes, or from 10 to 80% in 18 minutes, or {{convert|375|km|mi|abbr=on}} in half an hour{{cite web |last1=Klingenberg |first1=Mathias |title=Hyundai Ioniq 5: Plutselig kan elbilen fylle energi om kapp med bensinbilen |url=https://www.tu.no/artikler/hyundai-ioniq-5-plutselig-kan-elbilen-fylle-energi-om-kapp-med-bensinbilen/511102 |website=Tu.no |publisher=[[Teknisk Ukeblad]] |archive-url= https://web.archive.org/web/20210615170639/https://www.tu.no/artikler/hyundai-ioniq-5-plutselig-kan-elbilen-fylle-energi-om-kapp-med-bensinbilen/511102 |archive-date=15 June 2021 |language=no |date=15 June 2021 |url-status=live}} with its 800{{nbsp}}V charging capabilities by using a 350{{nbsp}}kW charger. The 800{{nbsp}}V inverter is sourced from Vitesco Technologies, a subsidiary of the [[Continental AG|Continental]] group.{{Cite web|last=Randall|first=Chris|date=24 March 2021|title=Vitesco to deliver 800-volt inverters for Hyundai's E-GMP|url=https://www.electrive.com/2021/03/24/vitesco-to-deliver-800-volt-inverters-for-hyundais-e-gmp/|access-date=8 April 2021|website=Electrive|language=en-us|archive-date=25 March 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210325031900/https://www.electrive.com/2021/03/24/vitesco-to-deliver-800-volt-inverters-for-hyundais-e-gmp/|url-status=live}} A five minutes charge will add {{cvt|100|km|mi|0}} to its range by [[WLTP (driving cycle)|WLTP]] standards.{{Cite web|last=Gitlin|first=Jonathan M.|date=23 February 2021|title=Here's the first of Hyundai's new 800-volt EVs—the Ioniq 5|url=https://arstechnica.com/cars/2021/02/this-crisp-looking-crossover-is-hyundais-next-ev-the-ioniq-5/|access-date=23 February 2021|website=Ars Technica|language=en-us|archive-date=23 February 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210223103405/https://arstechnica.com/cars/2021/02/this-crisp-looking-crossover-is-hyundais-next-ev-the-ioniq-5/|url-status=live}} {| class="wikitable collapsible" style="text-align:left; font-size:90%;" |+ Specifications{{Cite web|url=https://www.hyundai.com/kr/ko/e/vehicles/ioniq5/spec|title=제원|website=현대닷컴|access-date=27 April 2021|archive-date=27 April 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210427221046/https://www.hyundai.com/kr/ko/e/vehicles/ioniq5/spec|url-status=live}}{{Cite web|date=24 May 2021|title=Hyundai IONIQ 5 Electric CUV Disrupts EV Market with Ultra-Fast Charging and Vehicle-to-Load Power Capability|url=https://www.hyundainews.com/en-us/releases/3323|url-status=live|access-date=1 August 2021|website=Hyundai Newsroom|archive-date=25 May 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210525161021/https://www.hyundainews.com/en-us/releases/3323}}{{Citation|title=Vehicle Highlights {{!}} 2022 IONIQ 5 {{!}} Hyundai|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jLXA6cc7ens|language=en|access-date=1 August 2021|archive-date=1 August 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210801133517/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jLXA6cc7ens|url-status=live}}{{Cite web|title=Hyundai Ioniq 5 Gets Official EPA Range Rating: Up To 303 Miles|url=https://insideevs.com/news/552361/hyundai-ioniq5-epa-range-efficiency/|access-date=13 December 2021|website=InsideEVs|language=en}} !Battery !Layout !Power !Torque !0{{ndash}}100{{nbsp}}km/h

(Long Range) | RWD | {{cvt|160|kW|PS hp|0}} | {{cvt|350|Nm|lbft|sigfig=3}} | 7.4{{nbsp}}s | {{cvt|451–481|km|mi|0}} (WLTP){{Cite web|last=Hawkins|first=Andrew J.|date=23 February 2021|title=Hyundai's electric Ioniq 5 crossover could be the ultimate camping companion|url=https://www.theverge.com/2021/2/23/22296991/hyundai-ioniq-5-electric-suv-ev-battery-range-specs|access-date=24 February 2021|website=The Verge|language=en|archive-date=24 February 2021|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20210224005912/https://www.theverge.com/2021/2/23/22296991/hyundai-ioniq-5-electric-suv-ev-battery-range-specs|url-status=live}}

Year ! South Korea ! United States ! Global production |- | 2021 | 22,671 | 153{{cite web |url=https://www.hyundainews.com/en-us/releases/3475 |title=Hyundai Motor America Reports December, Q4 and 2021 Sales |date=4 January 2022 |website=hyundainews.com}} | 65,906 |- |} == Awards == * Car of the Year 2021, Mid-size Company Car of the Year 2021, and Premium Electric Car of the Year 2021 from ''[[Auto Express]]'' at the New Car Awards 2021.{{Cite web |title=New Car Awards 2021: the winners |url=https://www.autoexpress.co.uk/new-car-awards-2021 |access-date=21 April 2022 |website=Auto Express |language=en}} * Won 2021 IDEA Design Award gold prize. * 2022 New Zealand Car of the Year{{Cite web |title=Hyundai IONIQ 5 named New Zealand Car of the Year |url=https://www.hyundai.co.nz/hyundai-ioniq-5-named-new-zealand-car-of-the-year |access-date=21 April 2022 |website=Hyundai New Zealand |language=en}} * 2022 German Car of the Year * 2022 'Best Import Cars of the Year' by [[Auto Bild|''Auto Bild'']], winning the "Electric Car" category. * Ranked 2022 No. 1 Electric Car by ''[[Autozeitung]]'', receiving the highest score among electric cars. * Best Design at the '''[[Top Gear (magazine)|Top Gear]]'' Electric Awards 2021'. * 2022 World Car of the Year, World Electric Vehicle of the Year and World Car Design of the Year from [[World Car Awards]].{{Cite news |date=19 April 2022 |title=The Hyundai Ioniq 5 Wins The World Car Design of the Year for 2022 |url=https://www.hotcars.com/world-car-design-2022-hyundai-ioniq-5/ |access-date=21 April 2022 |website=HotCars |language=en-US}} * 2022 EV of the Year, ''[[Car and Driver]]''{{cite news |last1=Dyer |first1=Ezra |title=Presenting Car and Driver's 2022 EV of the Year |url=https://www.caranddriver.com/news/a40860789/2022-hyundai-ioniq-5-ev-of-the-year/ |access-date=3 September 2022 |work=Car and Driver |date=18 August 2022}} * 2022-2023 Japan Import Car of the year{{Cite web |title=Hyundai IONIQ 5 Wins Japan Import Car of the Year Award – Japanese Car News |url=https://japanesecarnews.com/hyundai-ioniq-5-wins-japan-import-car-of-the-year-award/ |access-date=2022-12-16 |language=en-US}} == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == {{Commons}} * {{Official website|https://www.hyundai.com/worldwide/en/ioniq/ioniq5}} {{Hyundai Motor
